title: Memory Palace
description:
An interactive mixed-media work that maps personal memories onto architectural spaces. The piece consists of a series of interconnected rooms, each representing a different period in the artist's life.

Visitors navigate through the installation using a custom-built interface that allows them to explore different memory layers. The work incorporates archival photographs, audio recordings, and 3D-printed objects that serve as memory triggers.

*Memory Palace* was first exhibited at the Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles as part of the "New Media Perspectives" group show.
